intro: Cinchona china, commonly known as Chinese quinine tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to southern China, where it grows in humid, mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its bark contains alkaloids, including quinine, which has historically been used in medicine. Due to its medicinal properties and conservation status, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and protected areas.
